required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Randomised Controlled Trial of Surgical Versus Non-surgical Treatment of Femoroacetabular Impingement

brief_summary.textblock: Femoroacetabular Impingement (FAI) describes a condition of the hip where additional bone results in the abutment of the femoral neck against the rim of the acetabulum. This gives rise to localised cartilage damage and pain, but also increases the risk of developing osteoarthritis. The purpose of this study is to compare the effectiveness of arthroscopic surgery versus physiotherapy and activity modification for the treatment of this condition.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.time_frame: 8 months post randomisation (approximately 6 months post intervention)
primary_outcome.description: Hip Outcome Score is a patient reported outcome measure

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Regular intervals up to 38 months post randomisation (approximately 3 years post intervention)
Regular intervals up to 38 months post randomisation (approximately 3 years post intervention)
Regular intervals up to 38 months post randomisation (approximately 3 years post intervention)

secondary_outcome.measure: Serum and Urinary Biomarkers of Osteoarthritis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Regular intervals up to 38 months post randomisation (approximately 3 years post intervention)
Regular intervals up to 38 months post randomisation (approximately 3 years post intervention)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Symptomatic patients
- Age 18-60 years
- Clinical and radiological evidence of FAI
- Competent to consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior hip surgery
- Established osteoarthritis (Kellgren-Lawrence >/= 2)
- Hip dysplasia (Centre-Edge angle < 20 degrees on radiograph)
- Completion of physiotherapy programme targeting FAI within past year
- Co-morbidities that mean surgical intervention is not possible/safe
- Contraindication to MRI
- Pregnancy

overall_official.last_name: Sion Glyn-Jones, MA MBBS FRCS DPhil

facility.name: Nuffield Orthopaedic Centre, Oxford University Hospitals Trust
